Message.Title: Stock futures fall as Fed fears weigh on markets
Message.Msg: Keep buying high...lol Stock futures fall as Fed fears weigh on markets Wall Street stock futures were on the decline Thursday morning amid growing concerns that the Federal Reserve will scale back its $85 billion a month bond-buying program. Ahead of the market open, Dow Jones Industrial stock futures dropped 0.27% to 15,248.00. The Standard & Poor's 500 stock futures index dropped 0.16% to 1,644.30. The tech-laden Nasdaq 100 declined 0.22% to 2,989.00.

Message.Title: China PMI at 50.1 or less is good for the market: Ya right????
Message.Msg: China's slowing factory sector may have barely grown in May amid lackluster local and foreign demand, a Reuters poll showed, adding to fears that the world's second-largest economy is losing steam. The median forecast of 10 economists polled by Reuters showed China's official Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) likely retreated to 50.1 in May from April's 50.6 to hover a whisker above the 50-point threshold

Message.Title: Sold at $210.30
Message.Msg: Wooohoo..thanks out to IBM See ya back $205 later..

Not this time. You may see it back at $210 after it pushes 215. My gut feeling on the US economy. Tried to buy some investment property last week and every house I looked at had a sale pending. Unbelievable.
Is buying back at $205 worth it for two two shares? Think of the commissions you incur and the headaches for your on line service.
